text: Joseph Albert Rosario "Rosie, Lolo" Couture (July 24, 1905 â€“ March 1, 1986) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player that played 8 seasons in the NHL; 7 seasons for the Chicago Black Hawks and 1 season for the Montreal Canadiens. Couture won the Stanley Cup with the Black Hawks in 1934. Couture along with Leroy Goldsworthy were given the task of helping identify the body of their Black Hawks teammate Jack Leswick when Leswicks body was pulled out of the Assiniboine River in August of 1934. ==Other websites== * * Category:1905 births Category:1986 deaths Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Stanley Cup champions
title: Rosario Couture
